website_summaries.verdict: Majority of the users of the New Balance 1500 T2 were pleased with this version. With various favorable comments regarding the shoe’s comfort level and dependability, it is apparent that users approved of the updates included by the brand. Overall, the 1500 T2 was considered to be a great running shoe that is also versatile.
pros: The 1500 T2 was very useful, from triathlons to daily training, according to a buyer
Another mentioned it was dependable on races or other long
The shoe was comfortable, said several users
Many wearers described the shoe as lightweight
A reasonably priced shoe, some purchasers said of the 1500 T2
The midsole of the 1500 T2 proved to be fast and responsive, a user observed
Perfect for transition runs, a runner claimed
One user appreciated the upper design, especially the shoelaces
cons: Some reviewers did not like firmer cushioning of the New Balance 1500 T2
A user said the toe box was too snug
The shoe was slightly more substantial than its lace-up version, a runner claimed

customer_reviews.title: I have wide flat feed that over pronate, and this is the best running shoe I have ever worn.
customer_reviews.text: I have wide flat feed that over pronate, and this is the best running shoe I have ever worn. I tried the 1500v3, really liked them but felt they were too narrow and the phantom fit curled up proving to be a distraction while running. Enter the 1500v4 and they made them slightly wider and it made a huge difference. I hate running, but with these shoes I actually enjoy my daily runs.
customer_reviews.author: Bullervick

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, lightweight, wide-fitting racer - A Class of its own
customer_reviews.text: I wore the V2's for over three marathons and 5 halves. The V4s fit similarly and have the same great "hugging" fit that is so characteristic of the 1500 series. I would definitely recommend the great comfort and lightweight nature of this shoe to anyone from sprinters to distance runners. NB does an amazing job with fitting a wide foot in a racer. This will be the second order of many of the 1500s
customer_reviews.author: Zbassdude

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, fast shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have used generation after generation of the 1500 for all of my running. On race days, I use these for marathons and Ironman 70.3 & 140.6. They’re light weight and feel great. As an aside, before this shoe, I suffered from a burning sensation in my left forefoot. I decided that it was from all the cushioning and deeper drops in today’s running shoes. I decided to take a chance and switched to this minimalist shoe. It resolved my foot discomfort and I’ve never run better.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G

customer_reviews.title: Quick.
customer_reviews.text: very light weight, lively, hi-speed shoes. Great tongue and lacing- and a back-to-basics wonderful running shoe with nothing fancy except for well thought-out design and excellent fit. I WISH they had a bit more sponginess to them but at speed that need goes away and you get a responsive, light shoe with great turn-over.
customer_reviews.author: BabyGiant

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware...hurts feet!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love new balance, but this is the worst model of shoe they have ever made! I knew it would run small, so I ordered a larger size & even with that my feet hurt really bad! I used temper pedic inserts and my feet still hurt which also made my back hurt! Don't chance it! Buy another model, it's not worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Jeramy

customer_reviews.title: what a great shoe! I normally am loyal to the RC1400 ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a great shoe! I normally am loyal to the RC1400 models but for some reason the reviews and looks of this shoe were calling my name. Boy, am I glad I bought these. I use to think I was a minimalist runner, always looking for shoes with the least amount of heel to toe drop. So when I got these I thought I would hate them. Far from the truth, I love them! Just the right amount of cushion and support but doesn't feel bulky like some Asics I have. The grip on the sole is great for outdoor running but it feels funny if using on the treadmill.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Fits right, out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: The NB 1500v4 is my go-to running shoe. This is my third set and they never fail to please. Light, comfortable, and rugged, I normally get year's worth of use from them before I wear the heel sole out. New one's slips right on and I never know the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Sepp

customer_reviews.title: Total let down
customer_reviews.text: Fit is ok at first. After about two months of use the bottoms are pealing off. Something in the arch of the right shoe pokes into my foot. Every pair of NBs I’ve ever worn were great. These are completely terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful color!
customer_reviews.text: The midsole is hard, so it's fine for sprint racing, but I don't think it's suitable for jogging, long-distance running or everyday wearing. It's not what I thought.
customer_reviews.author: Terry z

customer_reviews.title: Many compliments

customer_reviews.title: Bought a wide 9.5 but feels like a narrow 8.5 !!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a New Balance loyal customer and usually I love their shoes, but I have no love for this shoe. It’s too light, too small, and too narrow although It had a “wide” label on it ?!!? and the laces are just too short !! Steer away from these shoes.

customer_reviews.text: The sides of the tongue of the shoe are sewn in place and making the tongue tight across the top of the foot so that with the laces completely loose it is hard to get into the shoe. The length and width of the shoe were okay.

customer_reviews.text: Out of the box and right back in a few minutes later. Ordered the correct size but too narrow/small, and this was the wide size.

product_meta.title: New Balance Men's M1500tb2 Running Shoe
product_meta.description: New Balance 1500T2 Running Shoes Built for speed seekers, the new 1500T2 men's runner brings a fresh look to this classic series. Made with a breathable, lightweight upper featuring a Boa Fit System this shoe offers support and displays a race day-inspired design. Underfoot, a newly formulated REVlite midsole that's designed for a quicker rebound, offering the long-haul support needed from 5K to 26.2. FantomFit Skeletally Engineered Upper The New Balance 1500T2 Running Shoe are the perfect race day essential whether you are running a half marathon or a traithlon, these running shoes are highly versatile for all your running needs. A perforated synthetic mesh upper envelopes your foot in breathability, allowing cool air to circulate to keep you feeling cool and comfortable. Created by fusing two thin materials with a no-sew process the lack of seams and smooth transition of materials generates a comfortable, irritation free fit that fits securely around the foot, without the distraction of rubbing seams digging into the skin so you can focus on the road ahead. The Meta-Lock midfoot wrap creates a snug fit by hugging your foot in place without restricting movement. The slip on style bootie construction offers a stabilising, secure fit with easy on/off assist through the addition of heel tabs - perfect for slipping on and off during a triathlon race or for throwing on for a quick jog around the park. A streamline design works to slice through the air with every step reducing drag for fast footing. Finished with a Boa closure system, the New Balance 1500T2 Running Shoe allows an adjustable, customised fitting midfoot that locks down on the fly so you feel locked in and secure all run long. REVlite Midsole Constrcuted using New Balance's developed REVlite midsole, this provides the shoe with premium responsiveness and durability.
